computer.builtInGames: Basic interpreter in a removable ROM
computer.description:
The Nixdorf PC 05 was made by Panasonic (Matsushita Electric Ind.). It was same machine as the Panasonic FH-2000.
It was sold only in Germany, either under its own brand name, or under the name of companies which used it for custom applications.
computer.keyboard: 90 keys with arrow keys and numeric keypad
computer.language: Basic interpreter in a removable ROM
computer.name: PC 05
computer.rom: 64 KB + up to 512 KB in 4 ROM sockets

shot.description: <br><font color="red"><strong>&gt;&nbsp;NIXDORF PC 05</strong></font><br><blockquote>When shitched on, the computer displays all available built-in and ROM programs.<

<br><font color="red"><strong>&gt;&nbsp;BOTH SIDES</strong></font><br><blockquote>On the right hand side: Power button, contrast adjustment, External AC adaptor jack and Serial mini-DIN socket.<br> On the left hand side: 40-pin expansion connector used to connect the printer-extension interface.<
<br><font color="red"><strong>&gt;&nbsp;MD-08 PRINTER MODULE</strong></font><br><blockquote>40 to 160 column thermal printer. The module also holds 8 extra ROM sockets and its own battery pack.<
